title: A little miffed by one thing that complicates climbing as an All Rounder.
body:
Okay. I haven't played much so maybe someone's already covered this.

I've been occasionally placing different roles on my low elo account, and discovered the following:

I received Top 100 LP after I won a "Fill" Support game, which put my Support into Promotions.

_**However: Apparently, just to get that 100 LP on Top to Promotions, I have to win ANOTHER game just to get to Top promotions.**_

I cannot understate what I just said: _**To Multi-rank, you literally have to get the equivalent of 120+ LP just to Promote. **_

And..... if you play ANY OTHER ROLE before that 1 game, your splash can drop you down.

This is going to lead to some insane problems:
-You will have to play 20% more games to climb overall.
-You will still have to deal with promotions and the LP loss within it.
-You have to play 4-5 times as many games JUST TO Progress your secondary roles!

I Don't know about you, but I don't have time for 14,000 games a year. There's only 8,760 hours in a year! Last year I clocked about 3000 games! I'm getting older. League's community as a whole is getting older. Does Riot know what happens when players get older?

-They get families, jobs, school, and have to pay bills.

And....

THEY HAVE A LOT LESS TIME TO PLAY GAMES

replies.body:
Progress Report.

Ofc on the game I went top to try to get the Promotion started, I got an int feeding troll Heimerdinger Support with a 27% Win rate. He literally went 1/11 in 16 minutes, feeding most of it to a Vayne.

So now that role is down to 83 LP, because Riot can't let 100 LP = Promotions. If it had been promos, I would have 2 games to make up the int feeding player. But nah.

Theoretically, this means you can have Challenger MMR in a role in Iron IV.

Win as Top to 100 LP. Lose as Support to drop Top down to 97 LP. Win as Top again. Lose as Support again. Rinse and repeat.

Expected effect is your Top MMR keeps climbing infinitely without advancing tiers.

You know what's funny?

I'm at 29 wins 15 losses and still not through a Promo series for ANY role. Any other season: I'd have went up 2-3 tiers.
your roles join together at master tier. So you could do this with diamond, but not so much master.

That was always possible even in previous season, and without losing a game on purpose in a secondary role (which is still a bannable offense, losing on purpose...). You just have to dodge while you're in promo series. Counts as a loss for Promos, but doesn't drop your MMR, so you can have as high a MMR as you want while still being Ranked in Iron4.

But that doesn't matter anyway, because Matchmaking use your MMR directly, not your Rank, so you'll still get fair games.
You could already do this in previous seasons by just dodging your promos games.

https://imgur.com/a/7hJKPoF 
This has been out for almost a week...

If they follow through with that 9.4 Note, that'll be helpful.

However, I see a problem in that too.

The current system DOUBLES the reward in LP Splash for a "Fill" player vs a 1 role main who just happens to get his secondary choice.

What this is going to create:

-Low elo High win rate Fill accounts who are languishing behind 1 tricks who are racing up tiers, because their points are more spread out, but constantly going up because their splash is greater than their loss LP.

(This is me right now. I have about a 67% Win rate in almost 40 games on this account, placed my low elo account into B II, and am barely getting to BI/S IV on my fill roles)

In other words, I'm performing so well at this elo, and going to continue to perform well because:

-The one tricks who are successful are moving up the tiers.
-The one tricks who are unsuccessful, are moving down tiers or staying the same as me, feeding me more, because I'm a better player. 

----------------------------------------------------------------

In other words, Riot is looking to punish bad performers, but hasn't said anything about balancing out how "Fill" works at getting people to their appropriate skill level. I will maintain this 67% Win rate, and probably get even better as I warm up. But I'll always be 3-4 tiers behind the people I SHOULD be playing against, because they are 1 tricking and I am not. They may even be only getting a 50% win rate at those tiers too.

In my opinion, that's a major problem. It endorses Smurfing, and literally creates a system where the players are NOT equally matched.

Hum, why would you keep that 60+% winrate? As long as your winrate is above 50%, your MMR will keep increasing and you will get harder and harder opponents, until it gets down to roughly 50%.

There might be a disconnect between your MMR and displayed Rank, and you might play against people who are *Ranked* a couple divisions higher than you, but y'all will have the same MMR in the game. You will BE playing against the people you SHOULD be playing, pretty soon.

I sympathise with you.

Or just play the champ you 100% Win rate with in all roles o.O (Just kidding I know most people can't do this; I had a 100% Win rate with Morgana in Season 7 in 56 games with her and I'm not far off this season...... mostly in jungle >.>)

Then again, I'm playing her way outside my skill level with her >.>

"

I  abused her too. On support though. Up until high gold where people understand not to reset my W she is pretty hard to lose on. And I would guess she better in a role with more agency.
Comet+scorch+Cheapshot and you feel like playing farmvile simulator xD

Dodging also reduces LP on **_ALL_** your roles. So if you're at the 10 LP threshold (2nd, 3rd, or 4th dodge of the day) you lose 10 LP from ALL positions, not just the one you dodged. Have fun trying to climb.
Or........ you just don't dodge.

Unfortunately this is the best option if you want to play all roles. I'd rather play a completely lost game with a troll and lose 20LP on one role than lose a total of 50LP over 5 roles. Even 3 LP in each role is a struggle and it can add up.

They split Ranked into 3 splits to get all the rewards and intentionally increased the LP grind

They know what they're doing.  They're trying to get people addicted to have a dedicated population.

Agreed.  The current system sucks.  Add to the issue that losing on an off role can demote you if you are at 0LP and this year ranked is the land of suck.

They need to really crank up LP gains, losses and splashing.  At least double it.
Worst Season Yet

I like playing different roles and would say ive got 2-4 champs in each role that I can play at my level. But I need to play the same amount of games in each role to climb at an even level. WHos fucking idea was that. I dont have time for that! I just wanted to hit gold this year

I think if you're an average player, it's a blessing in disguise. You only lose 3 LP as a Fill. But you gain 6 as a win. And the role you get filled in still gets full points.

In other words, the math of "Fill" is on the average side. Once you start going, even if you perform at 50%, you'll probably get to gold more reliably than you would risking 50% as a one role player. 1 role is designed to stalemate. 4-5 roles isn't as long as you can perform in them.

Right now I'm about 70% win rate and getting into my promos for Silver IV from B I in most classes. Yesterday I was promos from BII to BI. Even if you are a 50% player, it's likely you can hit a promo every other day, and the teams at promos aren't as bad, because most people who are single classing are not there to compete with you. You're basically an Average all rounder facing Average Single Rolers.

Thats an interesting point. Still I have despised bot lane as a whole since before preseason. And right now its lucian or ez. Jinx being the other option from what it looks like. And support is thresh, ali fell off, brand, i hear sona is average. But its so stale

You're referring to the splash, right?

P.S. you almost exclusively Jungle..... your other games were just to unlock the roles.

This is an interesting fact that I didn't know about, so thank you for sharing. As someone who's going to try and climb in multiple roles, this is good information to have.

I do think it's a bit unfair to flex players, as you said, but the main question I have at the moment is this; how WOULD you implement having 100 LP = promos?

* Would wins in other roles count as wins in the promo, or maybe winning a certain amount of games counts as a win in the promo? The flip side could be said about losses, too.

* Seeing as LP splashing is a thing, would you drop from 100 LP if you lose in an off-role? If LP splashing is turned off once a role reaches promos, then that eliminates the incentive against people trolling when they get off roles. While I do agree that LP splashing isn't an entirely effective way against trolls, it's better than nothing. 

* Is there maybe a way you can avoid promos in an off-role? Of course, this alternative method would have to be a lot longer and harder work than the promo series itself, but maybe another form of promoting is needed in this case.

* How many players actually play more than one role willingly in ranked? Is it worth making changes such as these to benefit them? I know that I'm one of those people but honestly, I'm not sure what percentage of the sample I fall into.

Those are just some ideas I'm thinking of when it comes in terms with this issue, but I'd like to hear thoughts if you want to share.

Atm multiple roles works like this once you are in promotions:

The role that is in promotions neither loses nor gains LP when a game is played in another role. 

The roles that are NOT in promotions lose/gain splash LP when you play a promotional game.

In other words, if you "Fill" and manage to get the role you are in promotions in, you can still gain 3-6 LP splash in other roles when you win.
